caption:
This photograph depicts a ceremony taking place inside a church. The setting is pleasantly decorated, with colorful stained glass windows in the background that cast a warm light into the room. In the foreground, a group of people is standing, dressed in formal attire.

On the left, there are several men wearing dark suits with boutonnieres pinned to their lapels. Among them, a young boy in a similar dark suit is visible. This side of the group shows more men than women.

On the right side, a priest or officiant, wearing a white robe with a religious cross around his neck, is holding a red book, likely a prayer or service book, and appears to be leading the ceremony. Adjacent to him, there is a line of women dressed in black outfits, each adorned with large white lace collars and white hats. They also hold bouquets of yellow flowers, adding a contrasting splash of color to their dark dresses.

The composition captures a formal, solemn moment during a religious service or ceremony, with attendees focused on the proceedings led by the officiant. The photograph conveys a sense of tradition and ritual, highlighted by the attire of the participants and the setting.
title: Typical fall wedding in New Ulm, Minnesota.  Following the church ceremony the couple hosted a wedding dance in the evening at the turner club gymnasium.  New ulm is a county seat trading center of 13,000 in a farming area of south central Minnesota.  It was founded in 1854 by a german immigrant land company that encouraged its kinsmen to emigrate from europe.  Several manufacturing firms have located here since 1950 and have spurred growth
